title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 14 July 2013 - XWiki
content:
<junix659> ok need some help, i'm using this on CentOS 6.4  http://pastebin.com/jrqRKzWi  
00:21 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
00:22 <kstuart> has quit  
00:36 <junix659> got it working!  
00:43 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
01:06 <junix659> to install plugins, do i just drop them into the WEB-INF/lib folder?  
01:08 <sdumitriu> junix659: You should use the extension manager from the administration area  
01:08 <sdumitriu> And it depends on what you mean by "plugins"  
01:08 <junix659> found it!  
01:09 <sdumitriu> Old plugins need to be registered in xwiki.cfg, but those are deprecated  
01:09 <sdumitriu> Components can indeed just be dropped in WEB-INF/lib  
01:09 <sdumitriu> XARs must be imported  
01:09 <sdumitriu> But the extension manager takes care of everything for you  
01:10 <junix659> looks like i'm missing some dependencies...  
01:11 <junix659> if something is incompatible with provided version 4.2, do i need to upgrade something else?  
01:11 <junix659> or is that the version of xwiki?  
01:12 <sdumitriu> What's 4.2? Your wiki version, or the version that the extension requires?  
01:12 <junix659> the version the extension requires  
01:13 <sdumitriu> And you're using 5.1?  
01:13 <junix659> i'm guessing so  
01:13 <sdumitriu> Should be written at the bottom of the page  
01:13 <junix659> ah yes  
01:13 <junix659> i am  
01:13 <sdumitriu> Which extension are you trying to install?  
01:13 <junix659> office importer  
01:13 <junix659> TOC Macro  
01:14 <junix659> HTML Macro  
01:14 <junix659> Administration App  
01:15 <junix659> as i go through it i'm finding out what i can use  
01:20 <sdumitriu> All those are included already  
01:41 <kstuart> has quit  
01:45 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
01:53 <abusenius> has quit
